text: [Music]
he everyone welcome back to my channel
this is dor I'm a teacher of English and
today we're going to talk about a
question I get asked a lot on Facebook
and YouTube on my website uh you name it
so the question lots of you ask me is
can I use all capital letters in
listening um the short answer is yes you
can but let's look at it a little bit
further first of all this is the
official answer taken by the official
British Council I's website as you
listen write your answers on the
question paper at the end of the test
you will have 10 minutes to transfer
your answers uh to the separate answer
sheet in pencil you may write your
answers either in lowercase or in
capital letters so you can write all
capital letters in your answers in the
separate an she no problem if you wish
you can do that however if you choose to
write in lowercase letters you should
follow some rules for example uh if you
are about to write the name of a person
or the name of a place the first letter
should be capitalized for example John
uh Europe J and D are going to be in
capital letters so when do we have to
use a capital letter let's go and have a
look at some rules that they're going to
be very helpful not only for your
listening but also for your reading
answers and especially your writing okay
number One never never never use a
lowercase with a personal pronoun I I is
always capitalized no matter where it is
located in the sentence for example how
can I help you although it is in the
middle of the sentence it is capitalized
okay number two we use a capital letter
when at the beginning of the sentence
after a full stop or when we want to
imitate oral speech for example he
achieved the I El band he needed age is
capitalized because we begin a sentence
okay full stop therefore he's very happy
T of therefore is capitalized after a
full stop okay um he said quotation
marks this is great so we imitate the
oral speech of the person who passed the
ALS exam we use quotation marks
therefore the first letter this is great
T is capitalized okay number three we
use a capital letter for holidays for
the days of the week for months etc for
example Christmas it is a holiday Sunday
Saturday uh May July the first letters
are always capitalized number four we
use capital letters for uh abbreviations
for example USA uh United Arabic
Emirates is number five we use a capital
letter for Count's geographical regions
places cities towns landmarks etc for
example Europe Russia the iel tower the
river tames London um Milan you name it
okay number six we use a capital letter
for people's names John Smith for
example J and S are both capitalized the
first name and the Sur name seven we use
a capital letter for nationalities
Japanese Irish Canadian the first letter
is always capitalized okay number eight
we use a capital letter for uh religions
for example Christianity Buddhism ETC
number nine we use a capital letter when
we refer to famous companies worldwide
famous for example
Microsoft um
Apple hyai uh Etc you get the ADM number
10 for titles or professions for example
sir Harold Pinter sir is capitalized Dr
John Smith D is capitalized uh Professor
Williams p is capitalized last but not
least we also use capital letters for
titles or newspaper headings uh for
example uh titles of books of songs of
Articles uh and stuff like that for
example Crime and Punishment by Fodor
dooi um Ramy and Juliet by Shakespeare
Yellow Submarine by beel okay so that's
pretty much all you need to know
